alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn; Southern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 6:04PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Big Horn County through 630 PM MDT... At 603 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southwest of Busby, or 28 miles southeast of Hardin, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail, wind gusts in excess of 40 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Torrential rainfall may lead to localized flooding and ponding of water on roadways. Locations impacted include... Busby and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Big Horn; Southern Big Horn
